comment: This class is a lot of work, there is a huge business plan that will take about 150 hours per person on the team in order to finish. The class should be titled, how to write a business plan, as the rest of the material seem like supporting material (and of little use). Otherwise, not a bad class.

Awesome teacher for this class. There are 3 tests which he gives study guides/practice tests for. There is a group presentation and paper and an individual paper, but he does prepare you for them and grades fairly. Quizes are on web CT and class attendence is required but he actually makes class fun so it's not so bad!!

This class is not easy.  Marko Horn asks for alot but if you go to class, do the work, and study for the tests then you'll do fine.  There is alot of work but it is graded fairly.  You will get out of it what you put into it.  I would take him again for any management class.  He is a good professor.

Terrific teacher!!!!  You'll work hard but you'll also learn a lot.  He's extremely helpful, enthusiastic, and insightful.  He's very good at using real world examples in correlation with the book/class material.  Do yourself a favor and take him!
Great guy, covers material very well.  Does have a group paper due end of semester.  I would take again if possible.
this guy rocks! tests are average, but quizzes are on web ct, and take them as often as you like! takes attendance, but is well worth taking his class- he makes management seem really easy.
Great professor! easy going-has a slight German accent. Is willing to do most anything to help his students. Tests are thorough, so if you're lazy, find another teacher-or go to Auburn.
